intro: Oncoba schweinfurthii, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, spherical clusters of white or yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive appearance. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. Oncoba schweinfurthii is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
